basics.name: Michael Chase
basics.label: Data Scientist | Software Engineer | Researcher
basics.summary: Highly motivated and results-driven professional with a strong interdisciplinary background in computer science, data science, and research, specializing in AI/ML and interactive systems. Proven ability to lead complex technical projects, innovate solutions, and communicate effectively across diverse audiences.

work.name: Air Force Research Laboratory
work.summary: Contributed to advanced AI-driven research and software development within a secure environment, focusing on human-AI teaming and complex system modeling.
highlights: Contributed to AI-driven research focused on modeling human operator cognition and decision-making within complex simulated environments (satellite operations), specifically on the Oko project (classified contributions).

Implemented and refactored JavaScript/Vue back-end code, aiding in open-source transitions (e.g., migrating from Docker Desktop to Podman) and improving system architecture; launched microservices within Docker containers.
Administered AI/ML-specific COLANET resources and assisted with PyTorch dependency installation in offline environments for unnamed projects.

work.name: Air Force Research Laboratory
work.summary: Led and contributed to diverse R&D initiatives, developing immersive educational and research tools using advanced simulation and IT infrastructure management.
highlights: Created virtual reality environments using Unreal Engine, C++, and Blueprints Visual Scripting.

Led and contributed to developing impactful educational and research tools, including a UE5 MPERPG for officer training, a VR watchstanding simulator with gaze-tracking, and a VR system for capturing human expert data (e.g., spray painting techniques) to train AI/robotic systems.
Contributed to lab operational readiness by assisting with network administration, GitLab configurations, firewall adjustments, and resolving diverse IT support requests.

Initiated, designed, and deployed a new lab website using Google Sites, significantly improving usability, content accessibility, and collaborative maintenance capabilities over the previous WordPress platform.
Delivered technical instruction and outreach presentations to students and stakeholders, promoting GRILL’s capabilities and fostering engagement with ongoing research initiatives.
Successfully transitioned from PCIP to PAQ status (May 2022) with an increase in responsibilities and leadership expectations.
Received an award and thank you letter from a brigadier general for contributions to the Bravo 11: Gran Torino project (Feb 2024, Schofield Barracks, Hawaii).

Awarded runner-up for best project (People's Choice) at Bravo 10 Biometrics (2022, Destin–Fort Walton, Florida) for a pilot dashboard built in Plotly using Python (Pandas, Matplotlib) to address pilot readiness and fatigue.
Developed Python-based administrative applications (e.g., 'Streamliner') to track student progress and improve learning outcomes by gathering information.
Built a Python application using standard/built-in libraries (Tkinter/Turtles) to teach K-12 kids Python during COVID, delivering presentations to schools like Southpointe Academy in Canada.
Single-handedly processed and provided 50 job shadows, leveraging my Python Turtles drawing application for educational outreach.
Attended CES Las Vegas 2023, reporting on new technologies for research project purchasing.

work.name: University of Dayton
work.summary: Managed technical aspects of live theatrical productions and events.
highlights: Programmed and operated lighting for various musicals, plays, and live events.
Aided in set construction, fly operation, and stage management for major productions.
Provided customer and personal service to clients.

work.name: University of Dayton
work.summary: Contributed to architectural modeling and technical documentation for campus facilities.
highlights: Produced technical drawings according to USITT standards using Vectorworks.
Dimensioned and modeled the PNC Arts Annex, a local theater.

work.name: London International Theatre Program
work.summary: Assisted with technical and logistical coordination for theatrical productions.
highlights: Applied critical thinking skills to provide new and innovative data analytics practices for production management.
Setup DMX lighting fixtures and other technical aspects for 'Pictures of Dorian Gray'.

work.name: University of Dayton
work.summary: Guided new students through leadership-focused orientation programs.
highlights: Introduced new students to the university through a leadership-focused camp.
Aided in various logistical functions during the freshmen orientation experience.

work.name: Somewhere Recording LLC
work.summary: Provided technical and logistical support in a professional recording studio.
highlights: Aided in various logistical and technical functions of the recording studio.
Gained hands-on experience with Pro Tools and Logic Pro.

work.name: Brecksville Community Center
work.summary: Ensured safety and provided customer service in a gymnasium environment.
highlights: Provided customer service to members.
Enforced gymnasium rules and policies.

work.name: Chromascape Inc.
work.summary: Assisted in chemical formulation and product testing for color products.
highlights: Developed formulas for color products that met all performance expectations.
Collaborated with other chemists to develop and perform tests for color and chemical products.

work.name: NASA Glenn Research Center
work.summary: Shadowed and assisted civil and electrical engineers in a 3-week immersive experience.
highlights: Shadowed and aided civil and electrical engineers in a 3-week experience at NASA.

education.summary: Currently pursuing Ph.D. in Computer Science.
Master's degree focused on advanced topics in Computer Science.

publications.name: Evaluating Of LLMs Ability to Make Scenario Based Training More Immersive And Improve Learning Outcomes
publications.summary: Initiated and prototyped a voice-interactive game using LLMs to generate dynamic NPC dialogue for a deception-based scenario; showcased this independent project and its technical framework in a successful poster presentation, lauded for clear communication to diverse audiences.

publications.name: Current Evolution of VR Input Modalities
publications.summary: Co-authored a paper presented at IT2EC 2023, discussing the current evolution and advancements in virtual reality input modalities.

interests.name: Hobbies
keywords: Caesar Creek Gliding Club (Flying, Volunteer Groundskeeping)

awards.title: Brigadier General Letter of Appreciation
awards.summary: Received formal recognition for contributions to the Bravo 11: Gran Torino project.

awards.title: Runner-Up, Best Project (People's Choice)
awards.summary: Awarded for outstanding work on a pilot readiness dashboard project.
